thread.title: Philip Lanieri's interception preserves RPI win
thread.title_full: Philip Lanieri's interception preserves RPI football win - Times Union

author: Staff reports
title: Philip Lanieri's interception preserves RPI win
text:
Senior defensive back Philip Lanieri III intercepted a potential go-ahead two-point conversion attempt with no time left on the clock to seal an RPI victory, 21-20, over host Hobart on Saturday matchup.
Trailing 21-14, Hobart sophomore quarterback Shane Sweeney hit sophomore tight end Zach Winters on a 21-yard touchdown strike with no time remaining to pull the Statesmen within an extra point of tying the game and forcing an overtime period. But Hobart head coach Mike Cragg passed on the opportunity to force overtime and went for the win instead before Lanieri picked off Sweeney's two-point attempt.
With the score tied at 14, RPI quarterback Jeff Avery tossed a six-yard touchdown pass to Pat Hogan to cap a 10-play, 38-yard drive to put the Engineers up, 21-14.
Avery finished the day 16-for-25 for 160 yards and three touchdowns, two of them going to Hogan. Senior receiver Logan Gaddar had a team-best six catches for 91 yards to lead the Engineers, who climbed to 6-2 overall and 4-1 in the Liberty League.
Brandon Shed had eight catches for 128 yards and Sweeney finished with 234 passing yards and two touchdowns to lead Hobart, which fell to 4-3 and 2-2.
RPI is off next week and returns to action on Nov. 7 at home against Springfield.
